ATOM.VALUE: A soft, aromatic white made from a clone of the Trebbiano grape. Flavors suggest melon, straw, citrus and mineral.

Vernaccia di San Gimignano is a lovely example of the intensely subtle white wines of the finest Italian artisan producers, such as Paolo Caciorgna of Paradiso. Lean, flavorful, and a fave of Michelangelo himself -- have some soon to experience Tuscany in a glass.

Many Italian Sauvignon Blancs are short and simple, but Petruccoâ€™s 1998 is a terrific exception. Its persistent, zesty components make this a wine to pair magnificently with linguini and clams in white-wine sauce. Fewer than 1,000 cases produced.
Piazzano Vin Santo 'Bianco dell' Empolese' (375 ml)
Vin Santo, or 'holy wine,' is one of Italy's great contributions to the vinous landscape, and Piazzano's is one of the finest we have tasted. 150 cases of half bottles produced.
A pleasant, refreshing, modern Italian white with hints of pear, blanched almonds, and springtime flowers. Pull the cork, pour yourself a glass, and slither into the backyard lounge chair.
This delicious white from the Piedmont region of northern Italy is delicately sweet and "frizzante" (bubbly). Naturally low in alcohol (only 5.5 percent!), it's a perfect aperitif.

From Italy comes this jazzy sparkler of impressive value. A beautiful wine with a faint blush color made from 75 percent Pinot Noir and 25 percent Chardonnay. A great choice when you're expecting a crowd!
This Italian bubbly is bursting with lively fruit flavors of Fuji apples, Asian pears, and melons, all well integrated into a soft mouthfeel with a long, clean finish.
A light-bodied, very dry white from the northwestern corner of Italy. A great choice for any simple preparation of fresh shellfish or fin-fish.
Tenuta di Tavignano Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

A brilliant, crisp Italian white from an appellation that rarely impresses. Green apple, straw, and mineral flavors with a long, dry finish that intensifies with mineral and citrus. A wine.com exclusive.
